image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: The government appears more likely to be preparing to fast-track the proposed Macquarie Point stadium through parliament instead of sticking with the Project of State Significance process.

title.children: Urgency creeps in as Tasmanian premier steps up response to stadium report

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a brown jacket looks into the camera with a large church out of focus in the background.

props.synopsis: The child sexual abuse royal commission gave victim-survivors of abuse hope that institutions would learn from their past mistakes. But seven years on from its final report, some victim-survivors are feeling let down all over again.

title.children: A 'second wave of institutional betrayal' is hurting abuse survivors

image.altText: Fallow deer roaming in bush land.

props.synopsis: A project to rehabilitate wetlands in Tasmania has been going since the 80s. It keeps getting destroyed by deer — and the community group involved has had enough.

title.children: Decades of work lost to feral deer — and this group is sick of it

image.altText: looking for modi podcast

props.synopsis:
Thousands of Tasmanians are struggling to put and keep a roof over their heads.

Winter is around the corner and for many that'll make tough times even tougher.

Tents, cars and vans have become a common site in our towns and cities as the cost of living pushes people to the brink.

What's being done to ease the crisis?

Featuring ABC reporter Georgie Burgess.

title.children: The growing tide of homelessness in Tassie

image.altText: Man in space suit giving thumbs up to ground crew.

props.synopsis: Polar explorer Eric Philips is the first Australian to fly on a SpaceX space flight and the fourth Australian in space.

title.children: One-time Tasmanian Eric Philips returns from space

image.altText: Man leans against fence, looks across farmland towards a peninsula in the distance.

props.synopsis: As Labor continues to target 82 per cent renewables by 2030, the amount of wind and solar in regional communities will continue to scale up. But balancing community and environmental interests has been challenging for companies and governments.

title.children: 'It split the town': Australia grappling with wind farms and social licence

image.altText: A photo of the Nickel factory sitting by the coast under blue skies.

props.synopsis: A billion-dollar bet on nickel mining gave many New Caledonians hopes of economic prosperity and political independence. But after the market turned, the mine has left behind a ghost town full of broken hearts.

title.children: Hundreds once worked here — then the mine fell silent. What went wrong?

image.altText: A graphic of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton cut-outs

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is starting the day in the Northern Territory and Peter Dutton is campaigning in Melbourne. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese hits campaign milestone as Dutton heads west

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Voluntary redundancies on the table to slash public service, Coalition says
Chalmers isn't rushing to chat with China — but he doesn't rule it out in the future

image.altText: Composite of two ad campaigns, one of Anthony Albanese and one of Peter Dutton.

props.synopsis: Third parties including Clive Palmer's Trumpet of Patriots, conservative group Advance and Climate 200 have also funnelled significant amounts into online advertising to start the election campaign.

title.children: Parties spend $1.4m on Meta and Google ads in week one of campaign

image.altText: Collage of electricity bill behind a green mountain with powerlines on orange background.

props.synopsis: We take a closer look at the average power bill to see which sections Australians should be keeping an eye on or asking questions about.

title.children: Understanding power bills and how consumers are using this to save

image.altText: Pauline Hanson in the senate

props.synopsis: One Nation leader Pauline Hanson has taken credit for major party policies during a blistering and rare appearance on 7.30, where she also said she has no regrets in her political career.

title.children: No regrets for Pauline Hanson during controversial career

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: Wall Street reverses some of its gains after a historic rally on Wednesday. The ASX is set to follow as the US-China trade war upends financial markets. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to fall as Wall St ends historic rally on tariff fears

image.altText: Annette looks into the camera with a solemn expression, a photo of her deceased son hangs on the wall.

props.synopsis: Australian Super is one of two super funds being sued by ASIC over the handling of death benefit claims. A First Nations family says a deceased family member was mistreated by the fund.

title.children: A super payment went to the wrong account but the fund says it's not to blame

image.altText: A soldier is seen partially inside a tank.

props.synopsis: By the time MP Mike Martin described it as "inevitable" last month, conscription was well and truly back in Britain's national conversation, and some people are not against the idea.

title.children: Conscription is 'inevitable' for UK, says MP eyeing war with Russia

image.altText: A woman and a toddler sit on a floor playing with toys

props.synopsis: More than 77 per cent of households in the south-east Queensland electorate of Blair are feeling some form of financial stress — and as the federal election nears, it's a problem playing out across the country.

title.children: If you map financial stress, you'll find these 'aspirational Australians'

image.altText: Rows of cars in a car park, with stacked shipping containers behind them.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton says a scheme to cut the emissions of cars and encourage electric vehicle uptake will be abolished under a Coalition government.

title.children: Coalition to abolish 'ute tax' fuel efficiency standards

image.altText: A woman takes a photograph of illuminated cherry blossoms in full bloom

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar has been tracking lower against all major currencies, making overseas travel more expensive in popular tourist destinations.

title.children: $25 for a glass of wine: Why you may want to rethink overseas plans

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Almost one year on from the alleged murder of Molly Ticehurst, supporters are travelling to Canberra to push for a national approach to domestic violence laws.

title.children: Plea for domestic violence bail reform so there's 'not another Molly'

image.altText: Gout Gout with fans at the national athletics championships in Perth.

props.synopsis: If anyone needs convincing about Gout Gout's impact, perhaps their doubts were erased at the Australian Athletics Championships on Thursday night, writes Luke Pentony.

title.children: How the 'Gout Gout effect' continues to leave crowds spellbound

image.altText: Two men wearing suits speak

props.synopsis: Election results trigger, or subsequently lead to, leadership resets. Even in the turmoil of a campaign, players will also have their eyes on the future.

title.children: Will both parties see a leadership change in the next parliament?

image.altText: Fossil jawbone as seen from the right.

props.synopsis: An analysis of a jawbone found off the Taiwanese coast reveals it belonged to a Denisovan, a mysterious human species that contributed some genetic material to Indigenous Australians and people living in Asia today.

title.children: Fossil jawbone confirms mysterious human lived in East Asia

image.altText: A group of men and women dance happily on a dimly lit nightclub dance floor

props.synopsis: As the federal election debate builds around Australia's migration numbers and the effect on the housing crisis, members of the Indian diaspora say they are witnessing a growing wave of online racism. At the same time, they watch on as politicians make "performative" gestures to try to win their vote.

title.children: From 'where's your visa' to 'give us your vote', this community just wants to belong

image.altText: Dressed in bright red leotards, a group of people hang from a rope suspended in the air. They flex their muscles.

props.synopsis: For more than 40 years, Circus Oz has been entertaining and terrifying audiences. Its latest show, Non Stop, does both while proving age is no barrier to being in the circus.

title.children: A 65-year-old circus artist performs a 'dive of death' in new MICF show

image.altText: Patrick Dangerfield screams in delight as teammates mob him

props.synopsis: With the whole AFL watching, Adelaide had everything set up for its perfect Gather Round welcome, only for Geelong to stroll in, crash the party and ransack the house on the way out.

title.children: As Adelaide welcomed the AFL to its party, Geelong ransacked the house

image.altText: A woman in a pick top stands in front of a man wearing a blue suit with a map graphic behind them.

props.synopsis: With a 0.2 per cent margin, high-profile candidates expect preferences to again decide the winner in Gilmore as Labor's Fiona Phillips faces former NSW Liberal minister Andrew Constance.

title.children: Candidates tip ultra-marginal NSW seat to go down to the wire again

image.altText: In vitro fertilisation

props.synopsis: Monash IVF has apologised after a woman unknowingly gave birth to a stranger's baby after the wrong embryo was transferred.

title.children: Woman gives birth to stranger's baby in Monash IVF embryo mix-up

image.altText: People walk along Opera House forecourt on a hot sunny day

props.synopsis: Since last August, Australia has baked through above-average temperatures and the BOM is predicting another winter of unseasonable heat.

title.children: BOM predicts one of the warmest winters on record

image.altText: Firefighters in a burnt out building

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating the cause of the blaze, and whether there were "any fire safety non-compliances".

title.children: Australian killed in fire at kids' cooking school in Singapore

image.altText: a genetically modified 'dire wolf' puppy

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Doctors walk off, the Coalition walks back, and a pop star is heading Down Under

image.altText: Jess Hull looks to her right after winning her heat at the national athletics championships.

props.synopsis: Travelling through multiple time zones was not going to stop Olympic silver medallist Jess Hull from competing at the Australian Athletics Championships in Perth.

title.children: From Jamaica to Perth: Jess Hull's 'long-haul' trip to run at national titles

image.altText: A man with short black hair sits in a museum in front of a glass artwork depicting cabbage leaves on a wall.

props.synopsis: Blending contemporary artwork with archival material, a new exhibition at the National Museum in Canberra promises to captivate and educate visitors about the little-known history of Aboriginal-Chinese people in Australia.

title.children: New National Museum exhibit 'a celebration' of Aboriginal-Chinese people

props.synopsis: Police are investigating an alleged assault on a beach on the Sunshine Coast that left a 60-year-old woman with broken ribs, spinal fractures, a fractured ankle, and a lacerated liver.

title.children: Woman suffers spinal injuries after dog owner 'rugby tackle' on beach

image.altText: A person lighting a candle in a darkened room

props.synopsis: The Easter long weekend is coming, which will mean a few days off for many Australians regardless of their religion.

title.children: Rare alignment of Easter celebration dates for Eastern and Western churches

image.altText: A freestanding Victorian-era house painted white with black wrought iron balustrades on the lefthand side

props.synopsis: What would you risk for the house of your dreams? That's the question Melbourne couple Stephanie and Paul Ryan grappled with when the opportunity arose to buy a rundown Victorian-era house that's under the threat of compulsory acquisition.

title.children: Couple's gamble on forever home could mean 'torturous' forced sale
